info.title: Text Translation
info.description:
Text translation is a cloud-based REST API feature of the Translator service that uses neural
machine translation technology to enable quick and accurate source-to-target text translation
in real time across all supported languages.

The following methods are supported by the Text Translation feature:

Languages. Returns a list of languages supported by Translate, Transliterate, and Dictionary Lookup operations.

Translate. Renders single source-language text to multiple target-language texts with a single request.

Transliterate. Converts characters or letters of a source language to the corresponding characters or letters of a target language.

Detect. Returns the source code language code and a boolean variable denoting whether the detected language is supported for text translation and transliteration.

parameters.name: Endpoint
parameters.description:
Supported Text Translation endpoints (protocol and hostname, for example:
    https://api.cognitive.microsofttranslator.com).

get.summary: Gets the set of languages currently supported by other operations of the Translator.
get.description: Gets the set of languages currently supported by other operations of the Translator.

parameters.name: X-ClientTraceId
parameters.description: A client-generated GUID to uniquely identify the request.

ETag.description:
Current value of the entity tag for the requested groups of supported languages. 
To make subsequent requests more efficient, the client may send the `ETag` value in an 
`If-None-Match` header field.

X-RequestId.description: Value generated by the service to identify the request. It is used for troubleshooting purposes.
Value generated by the service to identify the request. It is used for troubleshooting purposes.

parameters.name: X-ClientTraceId
parameters.description: A client-generated GUID to uniquely identify the request.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Defines the content of the request

X-RequestId.description: Value generated by the service to identify the request. It is used for troubleshooting purposes.

x-metered-usage.description:
Specifies consumption (the number of characters for which the user will be charged) for the translation 
job request. For example, if the word "Hello" is translated from English (en) to French (fr), 
this field will return the value '5'.

x-mt-system.description:
Specifies the system type that was used for translation for each 'to' language requested for translation. 
The value is a comma-separated list of strings. Each string indicates a type:

* Custom - Request includes a custom system and at least one custom system was used during translation.
* Team - All other requests

X-RequestId.description: Value generated by the service to identify the request. It is used for troubleshooting purposes.

parameters.name: X-ClientTraceId
parameters.description: A client-generated GUID to uniquely identify the request.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Defines the content of the request

X-RequestId.description: Value generated by the service to identify the request. It is used for troubleshooting purposes.
Value generated by the service to identify the request. It is used for troubleshooting purposes.

DetectedLanguage.description: An object describing the detected language.

language.description: A string representing the code of the detected language.

score.description:
A float value indicating the confidence in the result.
The score is between zero and one and a low score indicates a low confidence.

ErrorDetails.description: Error details as returned by Translator Service.

ErrorResponse.description: Representation of the Error Response from Translator Service.

InputTextItem.description: Element containing the text for translation.

values.name: LeftToRight
values.description: Language is written left to right.

values.name: RightToLeft
values.description: Language is written right to left.

name.description: Display name of the script in the locale requested via Accept-Language header.

nativeName.description: Display name of the language in the locale native for the language.

dir.description: Directionality, which is rtl for right-to-left languages or ltr for left-to-right languages.

values.name: NoAction
values.description: No Action is taken on profanity

values.name: Deleted
values.description: Profanity is deleted from the translated text.

values.name: Tag
values.description: Profanity is marked with the tags.

SentenceBoundaries.description: An object returning sentence boundaries in the input and output texts.

srcSentLen.description:
An integer array representing the lengths of the sentences in the input text. 
The length of the array is the number of sentences, and the values are the length of each sentence.

transSentLen.description:
An integer array representing the lengths of the sentences in the translated text. 
The length of the array is the number of sentences, and the values are the length of each sentence.

SourceDictionaryLanguage.description: Properties ot the source dictionary language

name.description: Display name of the language in the locale requested via Accept-Language header.

nativeName.description: Display name of the language in the locale native for this language.

dir.description: Directionality, which is rtl for right-to-left languages or ltr for left-to-right languages.

translations.description: List of languages with alterative translations and examples for the query expressed in the source language.

SourceText.description: Input text in the default script of the source language.

text.description: Input text in the default script of the source language.

TargetDictionaryLanguage.description: Properties of the target dictionary language

name.description: Display name of the language in the locale requested via Accept-Language header.

nativeName.description: Display name of the language in the locale native for this language.

dir.description: Directionality, which is rtl for right-to-left languages or ltr for left-to-right languages.

code.description: Language code identifying the target language.

TranslateBodyDetails.description: Request body parameters for the translate API.

text.description: Specifies the text string to be translated in the translate API.

script.description: Specifies the script of the input text.

language.description:
Specifies the language of the input text. Find which languages are available to translate by 
looking up supported languages using the translation scope. If the language parameter isn't 
specified, automatic language detection is applied to determine the source language.

You must use the language parameter rather than autodetection when using the dynamic dictionary feature. 
Note: the dynamic dictionary feature is case-sensitive.

textType.description:
Defines whether the text being translated is plain text or HTML text. Any HTML needs to be a well-formed, 
complete element. Possible values are: plain (default) or html.

TranslateBodyParameters.description: Request body parameters for the translate API.

language.description:
Specifies the language of the output text. The target language must be one of the supported languages included 
in the translation scope. It's possible to translate to multiple languages simultaneously by including 
multiple string values in the targetsLanguage array.

script.description: Specifies the script of the translated text.

profanityAction.description:
Specifies how profanities should be treated in translations.
Possible values are: NoAction (default), Marked or Deleted.

values.name: NoAction
values.description: No Action is taken on profanity

values.name: Deleted
values.description: Profanity is deleted from the translated text.

profanityMarker.description:
Specifies how profanities should be marked in translations.
Possible values are: Asterisk (default) or Tag.

values.name: Tag
values.description: Profanity is marked with the tags.

deploymentNameModel.description:
Default is ‘general’, which uses NMT system.
‘abc-inc-gpt-4o’, and ‘abc-inc-gpt-4o-mini’ are examples of deployment names which use GPT-4o uses or 
GPT-4o-mini model. ‘gpt-4o’ uses GPT-4o model. 

‘<custom model id>’ uses the custom NMT model tuned by customer.
‘best’ system determines which is the best model to use for the request. This intelligence could be introduced
in future. Customer should have deployed it in their resource.

allowFallback.description:
In the case where a custom system is being used, specifies that the service is allowed to fall back to a
general system when a custom system doesn't exist. 
In the case where a Large Language Model is being used, specifies that the service is allowed to fall
back to a Small Language Model if an error occurs.
Possible values are: true (default) or false.

allowFallback=false specifies that the translation should only use systems trained for the category specified 
by the request. If a translation for language X to language Y requires chaining through a pivot language E, 
then all the systems in the chain (X → E and E → Y) will need to be custom and have the same category. 
If no system is found with the specific category, the request will return a 400 status code. allowFallback=true 
specifies that the service is allowed to fall back to a general system when a custom system doesn't exist.

grade.description: Defines complexity of LLM prompts to provide high accuracy translation.

adaptiveDatasetId.description: Reference dataset ID having sentence pair to generate adaptive customized translation.

referenceTextPairs.description: Reference sentence pairs to generate adaptive results.

proj.description:
Maps input text to translated text. The alignment information is only provided when the request 
parameter includeAlignment is true. Alignment is returned as a string value of the following 
format: [[SourceTextStartIndex]:[SourceTextEndIndex]–[TgtTextStartIndex]:[TgtTextEndIndex]]. 
The colon separates start and end index, the dash separates the languages, and space separates the words. 
One word may align with zero, one, or multiple words in the other language, and the aligned words may 
be non-contiguous. When no alignment information is available, the alignment element will be empty.

detectedLanguage.description: The detectedLanguage property is only present in the result object when language auto-detection is requested.

translations.description:
An array of translation results. The size of the array matches the number of target 
languages specified through the to query parameter.

sourceText.description:
Input text in the default script of the source language. sourceText property is present only when 
the input is expressed in a script that's not the usual script for the language. For example, 
if the input were Arabic written in Latin script, then sourceText.text would be the same Arabic text 
converted into Arab script.

TranslationLanguage.description:
The value of the translation property is a dictionary of (key, value) pairs. Each key is a BCP 47 language tag.
A key identifies a language for which text can be translated to or translated from.

name.description: Display name of the language in the locale requested via Accept-Language header.

nativeName.description: Display name of the language in the locale native for this language.

dir.description: Directionality, which is rtl for right-to-left languages or ltr for left-to-right languages.

result.description: Array of the translated text elements.

to.description: A string representing the language code of the target language.

text.description: A string giving the translated text.

transliteration.description: An object giving the translated text in the script specified by the toScript parameter.

sentLen.description: Sentence boundaries in the input and output texts.

TransliterableScript.description: Script definition with list of script into which given script can be translitered.

toScripts.description: List of scripts available to convert text to.

text.description: A string which is the result of converting the input string to the output script.

script.description: A string specifying the script used in the output.

TransliterationLanguage.description:
The value of the transliteration property is a dictionary of (key, value) pairs. 
Each key is a BCP 47 language tag. A key identifies a language for which text can be converted from one script 
to another script.

name.description: Display name of the language in the locale requested via Accept-Language header.

nativeName.description: Display name of the language in the locale native for this language.

scripts.description: List of scripts to convert from.

GetSupportedLanguagesParameters.acceptLa.name: Accept-Language
GetSupportedLanguagesParameters.acceptLa.description:
The language to use for user interface strings. Some of the fields in the response are names of languages or 
names of regions. Use this parameter to define the language in which these names are returned. 
The language is specified by providing a well-formed BCP 47 language tag. For instance, use the value `fr` 
to request names in French or use the value `zh-Hant` to request names in Chinese Traditional.
Names are provided in the English language when a target language is not specified or when localization 
is not available.

GetSupportedLanguagesParameters.ifNoneMa.name: If-None-Match
GetSupportedLanguagesParameters.ifNoneMa.description:
Passing the value of the ETag response header in an If-None-Match field will allow the service to optimize the response. 
If the resource has not been modified, the service will return status code 304 and an empty response body.

GetSupportedLanguagesParameters.scope.name: scope
GetSupportedLanguagesParameters.scope.description:
A comma-separated list of names defining the group of languages to return.
Allowed group names are: `translation`, `transliteration` and `dictionary`.
If no scope is given, then all groups are returned, which is equivalent to passing 
`scope=translation,transliteration,dictionary`. To decide which set of supported languages 
is appropriate for your scenario, see the description of the [response object](#response-body).

TranslateParameters.allowFallback.name: allowFallback
TranslateParameters.allowFallback.description:
Specifies that the service is allowed to fall back to a general system when a custom system doesn't exist. 
Possible values are: true (default) or false.

allowFallback=false specifies that the translation should only use systems trained for the category specified 
by the request. If a translation for language X to language Y requires chaining through a pivot language E, 
then all the systems in the chain (X → E and E → Y) will need to be custom and have the same category. 
If no system is found with the specific category, the request will return a 400 status code. allowFallback=true 
specifies that the service is allowed to fall back to a general system when a custom system doesn't exist.

TranslateParameters.category.name: category
TranslateParameters.category.description:
A string specifying the category (domain) of the translation. This parameter is used to get translations 
from a customized system built with Custom Translator. Add the Category ID from your Custom Translator 
project details to this parameter to use your deployed customized system. Default value is: general.

TranslateParameters.from.name: from
TranslateParameters.from.description:
Specifies the language of the input text. Find which languages are available to translate from by 
looking up supported languages using the translation scope. If the from parameter isn't specified, 
automatic language detection is applied to determine the source language.

You must use the from parameter rather than autodetection when using the dynamic dictionary feature. 
Note: the dynamic dictionary feature is case-sensitive.

TranslateParameters.fromScript.name: fromScript
TranslateParameters.fromScript.description: Specifies the script of the input text.

TranslateParameters.includeAlignment.name: includeAlignment
TranslateParameters.includeAlignment.description:
Specifies whether to include alignment projection from source text to translated text.
Possible values are: true or false (default).

TranslateParameters.includeSentenceLengt.name: includeSentenceLength
TranslateParameters.includeSentenceLengt.description:
Specifies whether to include sentence boundaries for the input text and the translated text.
Possible values are: true or false (default).

TranslateParameters.profanityAction.name: profanityAction
TranslateParameters.profanityAction.description:
Specifies how profanities should be treated in translations.
Possible values are: NoAction (default), Marked or Deleted.

values.name: NoAction
values.description: No Action is taken on profanity

values.name: Deleted
values.description: Profanity is deleted from the translated text.

TranslateParameters.profanityMarker.name: profanityMarker
TranslateParameters.profanityMarker.description:
Specifies how profanities should be marked in translations.
Possible values are: Asterisk (default) or Tag.

values.name: Tag
values.description: Profanity is marked with the tags.

TranslateParameters.suggestedFrom.name: suggestedFrom
TranslateParameters.suggestedFrom.description:
Specifies a fallback language if the language of the input text can't be identified. 
Language autodetection is applied when the from parameter is omitted. If detection fails, 
the suggestedFrom language will be assumed.

TranslateParameters.textType.name: textType
TranslateParameters.textType.description:
Defines whether the text being translated is plain text or HTML text. Any HTML needs to be a well-formed, 
complete element. Possible values are: plain (default) or html.

TranslateParameters.to.name: to
TranslateParameters.to.description:
Specifies the language of the output text. The target language must be one of the supported languages included 
in the translation scope. For example, use to=de to translate to German.
It's possible to translate to multiple languages simultaneously by repeating the parameter in the query string. 
For example, use to=de&to=it to translate to German and Italian.

TranslateParameters.toScript.name: toScript
TranslateParameters.toScript.description: Specifies the script of the translated text.

TransliterateParameters.fromScript.name: fromScript
TransliterateParameters.fromScript.description:
Specifies the script used by the input text. Look up supported languages using the transliteration scope,
to find input scripts available for the selected language.

TransliterateParameters.language.name: language
TransliterateParameters.language.description:
Specifies the language of the text to convert from one script to another. 
Possible languages are listed in the transliteration scope obtained by querying the service 
for its supported languages.

TransliterateParameters.toScript.name: toScript
TransliterateParameters.toScript.description:
Specifies the output script. Look up supported languages using the transliteration scope, to find output 
scripts available for the selected combination of input language and input script.
